parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From Kaisar; Caesaria, the name of two places in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
